documents.document: If you had lots of cash but your opposition had access to lots of volunteers, Sept 23 is a strategic election date.
Fun fact: every NZ First caucus since the 1996 election has contained at least one MP who is a migrant.
@jrmurphypoetry @nzherald @NZStuffPolitics Actually just hung up after you called me a Nazi and a f-ing maggot. Didn't raise my voice once.
@IainLG Done. I'll drop a line with your office and get the ball rolling
@IainLG Saw yr immigration press release, and agree we must tighten protections for immigrants. Happy to talk through report w/ you
@TimHunter5 "Let's pull some bitchin' capital charge action those health board ho's and get stunting on that scratch". Well, ahem, rather!
@TimHunter5 "Yo dog, that capital asset pricing model is da bomb."
@IainLG @_hehir_ Still would prefer 1,000 Thiels to one Bill Liu
@_hehir_ @IainLG Stand corrected: "Note that different rules apply depending on the type of overseas person. "
@_hehir_ @IainLG Nope! "You are an overseas person if you are neither a New Zealand citizen, nor ordinarily resident in New Zealand"
@IainLG @_hehir_ The difference is literally a passport. Plus Thiel is the unique kind of talent NZ needs. But, you know, politics
@_hehir_ @IainLG Now, wasn't it the Labour Party that granted him permanent residence in 2006?
Is there a more retarded OS than Apple? The answer is "no". I spit in Steve's grave
@oneforthedr Labour says credit agency report proves Nat govt not fit to hold office
What an absolute twat https://t.co/yO1fRKSCgS
@garethmorgannz not trying to be obtuse either but in buying a house aren't you effectively renting from yourself?
@garethmorgannz but presumably each dollar has already been taxed twice, PAYE and GST.
@garethmorgannz Why include cars in yr equity tax? Equity falls over time. Genuine question
@msbananapeel @Hamley_Maqnirez exactly. But downside of dino extinction: where will I get all my clickbait?
@msbananapeel @Hamley_Maqnirez buying media dinosaurs in the age of digital comets. Hmmm
@ThomasHaig @garethmorgannz It ain't free. Invoice is in the mail
@ThomasHaig @garethmorgannz Referring political optics. Home ownership rate is in 60s. How is this policy a vote winner?
@ThomasHaig appreciate you putting words in my mouth w/@garethmorgannz
@garethmorgannz You're in politics now. Good luck getting the middle to vote for a tax on their aspiration
So in a country that prides itself on home ownership @garethmorgannz , in seeking the popular vote, wants to tax home ownership. Okay then.
@cjsbishop This sounds like something Asenati would say, only without the words "semi", "reminder", "esque", "parody", "regular" & "account"
@JenesaJeram @DrAndrewButcher @RachelWebb37 Only a stereotype coz it is so prevalent. https://t.co/2a7sjj7xyS
@franks_lawyer From @EconBizFin "Under [Key] the country has been a haven of prosperity and stability" Tad Hyperbolic but comparatively true

Fuuuuuuuuu ⚡️ “Italian PM to resign over Referendum loss”
https://t.co/5YbfM5qL4i
"Depression is merely anger without enthusiasm" - Steven Wright. #notdepressed #fortherecord
Bloody migrants stealing Kiwi's jobs. What? Labour force participation rate at record high of 70.1%? Oh. Oh dear. https://t.co/EvLdDac7FE
@eloise_gibson I've read Kahneman (thinking fast and slow), Sunstein and Thaler (Nudge), so know the background material well.
@eloise_gibson It is on the reading list as of now
@eloise_gibson Very nervous over where a nudge turns into a shove w/ bad outcomes e.g. Kiwi saver default fund is conservative
@eloise_gibson On pref we keep finding "irrational" defined as choices ppl make that veer from what said expert would have chosen. eg sugar
@eloise_gibson Definition is useful for policy setting. Can govt know yr preferences better? More choice tends to mk ppl better off.
@eloise_gibson curious to see how it stacks it up. Coz economists define rational as ppl behaving consistent with personal preferences.
@ClintVSmith Ah, bliss of taxication. The feeling you get from a tax rebate. Lasts only until you realise it was your money to begin with.
@phil_goff's targeted rates on hotels to pay for Ateed not insane. Beneficiary pays rule. Q is why has this taken so long?
Hey @MaxRashbrooke here are some interesting fact on Uber, care of economist Julian Morris https://t.co/lGKLGHTBxa
Come on @FrankMcRae, stop holding back. Tell us you really feel
@FrankMcRae short memory. You forgot dubbyah
@ross_marks To quote Francis Urquhart: "You may well think that, but I couldn't possibly comment" https://t.co/u8aHhqoC86
@StaceyKirkNZ @cjsbishop @NZNationalParty Damn you Stacey, you beat me to it
@MattNippert "Live the brand" as former boss used to tell me (he dressed almost exclusively from the marketing gifts cupboard).
Sugar daddy? Pfft. I aspire to be a sugar baron. https://t.co/xrDP4LdxU2
How NZ politicians see Uber: Predatory cowboy gypsies lurking at a taxi rank near you. #21stcentury #robotsRcoming #abouttimetoo
@BenThomasNZ I know, right? I should be a perfect 5.0
@jo_moir @mwyp That's gypsy talk right there, you know the people who refuse to obey Parliament...
@katieabradford Are those all the remaining union members in NZ? Wow!
@mwyp If you though "gypsy" was gold I urge you to read the end.
What... the .... fark? https://t.co/7sosewxtha
@kaserlin the temerity to be in the path of your golf ball! Well deserved I say
@ParrotDog Love your work. Can't wait for you to be dishing it out at a location near my home. Drunk walking is still allowed, right?
@MattNippert @MaxRashbrooke @TimHunter5 that crawl space in San Fran rents for US$500/m shows extractive potential on land almost limitless.
@MattNippert @MaxRashbrooke But where do you live then? Still have to buy accommodation at current market rates, as noted by @TimHunter5
Battling to see the diff between radical preacher's antisemitic rant and Brian Tamaki blame gays for quake.
@robhosking @avancenz And here I thought that imodium was supposed to prevent the runs...
@robhosking @avancenz tre rock n' roll. Keiff would be proud
@EricCrampton I prefer when the classics go all death metal like: https://t.co/YygVJoO8Sb
Loathe as I am to admit that anyone could match the original, Richard Cheese might just have done exactly that: https://t.co/VW7kwwSZQY
@FrankMcRae Call him out on it. You may offend, but he can hardly call for censure.
@FrankMcRae There might be more to it than that, as Brendan O'Neil explains. https://t.co/9btEio5Skc
@LI_politico @sashaborissenko Got their hands on the last pro-free trade country in North America and they're not letting go
@rogerdennis @paulbrislen @WIRED Hey white people, here's another thing to feel guilty over (still not forgiven for hair metal)
@jo_moir I feel your pain. I ride a moped to work. Shudder to think what would happen if a quake struck while I was on it.
@jo_moir You do know that there is a +90% chance of a 6/7 magnitude quake in the next month, right?
Launching tonight at Macs in Wellington. Come find out how we can make local govt suck less: https://t.co/uIoN0pizmx https://t.co/Nyazp6a0w9
@TimHunter5 if StuffMe tanks where do I get clickbait from? Just today I read a bride wrote a nasty note to caterer #4thestate #vital
@ross_marks your comments cut him to the bone. He must salve the wound by buying another luxury automobile and some jewels for the wife.
@BGCraven It is like The Apprentice all over again

@rafmanji @nzinitiative Fret not Raf, one is on its way to you too
@JimRose69872629 @EricCrampton @alan_john_moran @SincDavidson A very pertinent question. There is a case to be made that Musk is rentseeker

@dbseymour @jo_moir I'd hoped you'd be serving something stronger
@Peter_Cresswell Total face palm moment. It so bloody dire.
@avancenz daaaamn, that is truly vile.
Hey @SEaqub. Loved the vid, but wondered if someone slipped something in my coffee at first. Also, haast and moa disagree on sustainability
@ross_marks I like GLOW: Gay, Lesbian or Whatever..."
When did gay turn so queer? https://t.co/v84MxG1P9Q
@FrankMcRae Not asking for different rulers. Asking for more accurate rulers & sanctions for those who lie to get projects across the line
@FrankMcRae Amid all the "rail is the future" love in the paper and among pollies of late, I thought it prudent to point this out
@FrankMcRae Now you're picking and choosing. Flyvbjerg's large data set is quite an edifice of evidence that shows rail tend to be worse
@FrankMcRae @nzinitiative Study shows road benefits under-est, not over! Costs too, but less thn rail. Pls read report (link in story) #oops
Amused to find someone set up a site diametrically opposed to @garethmorgannz's https://t.co/NpbY52hYsd. It's called https://t.co/hb23Roi2pk
@DrJessBerentson There are only 10 kinds of logical argument
@DrJessBerentson Seriously though, I'm beginning to think it is a gender neutral form of abuse. 'splainin' is a problem in general
@DrJessBerentson Mansplaining is when men explain things to women under the flawed assumption that women need it explained to them
@JenesaJeram @RachelWebb37 just so smart and insightful https://t.co/48JPPTa9OR
@geoffsimmonz while I have you on the line, great news about TOP. The election just got waaaay more interesting
@geoffsimmonz the sleep of the righteous and proud then
@oneforthedr those monitors aren't going to prop themselves up
@JimRose69872629 Weirdly just put that on the reading list today (from @Firing_Line_ column)

@ross_marks Weirdly I have been looking for an alternative therapy for my restless legs.
